subject: Re: [junit] How to unit test Eclipse Plugin and RCP?
msgSnippet: ... There is no question that Eclipse under Linux suffers at least a 50% performance hit on start-up--I ve measured on a dual-booting machine--plus more
messageBody:
Tim Hardy wrote:
>> BTW as bad as the Eclipse startup time is its not the end of the world 5-12
>> secs on my machine (guess it depends on what Windows has cached).
>>
>
> Just out of interest, would you mind sharing the specs of your machine?
> My desktop is pretty old - a 1.8G P4 with 768M of ram - and launching
> the runtime workbench takes 30-35 seconds. (I'm running Debian but I
> assume it's the hardware not the OS that's making the difference. Like
> all assumptions, this may be wrong.)


There is no question that Eclipse under Linux suffers at least a 50%
performance hit on start-up--I've measured on a dual-booting
machine--plus more noticeable UI lag, although that appears to have been
alleviated in 3.2 to some extent. Currently, on my 1GB, 2.4GHz P4, my
RCP app costs about 20 secs before any tests run.

David Saff
